monogr.title: The raising of them that are fallen : A discourse very profitable and beneficial to all faithfull Christians dialoguewise, betwixt a knight and a gentleman· Set foorth for the benefit and good of all such people as are afflicted eyther in minde or conscience. Written by Thomas Sauile Gent? [sic]
monogr.author: Savile, Thomas

div.head: To the Christian Reader.
div.p:
THE Life of Christians is fitly called a way because as trauaylers do sometimes erre, sometimes stumble, sometime slide, and somtimes fall, so christians wander in the plaine fields of this world, following the broad path of sinne, and forget • ing the strait and narrow way of piety, and grace, or else taken vniust occasion to stumble through their owne weakenes, eyther at the seueritie of diuine commended life, or the euill examples of some other erring, and sinning brethren in the Church, or slide and srink at the afflictions which accompany vnfained deuotion and god • ines, because they cannot tarry in hopefull expectation of comfor and re • esse, vntil the cloudy night of sorrowfull aduersitie be ouerpassed, and the sunne-shning fauour of peace grace and mercie from God the Father lighten their darkenes, through Iesus Christ: or else fal • flat downe vnder the desire of the present world, ouer burdened with the distrustfull worldly cares cast vpon them by Sathan: and so lie grouelling in the myre of humaine infirmitie. Distaine the pure wedding garment which Christes Gospell hath cloathed them withall. This being the vn-auoidable lot of many of God his deare Children, it is a world to thinke how wonderfully good mindes (though weake) lye drawing their last breath, betwixt hope and feare, sleepe and waking, perseuerance and oppostasie, liue perplexed: seeking and caling for direction, eyther meet with no man to set them in the right way, when they haue erred, or else by reason of their owne blindnes cannot follow the right path they are set in, hauing no guides to holde them by the hand, or if they haue stumbled, there is no man that will remoue the block out of their way, or lift vp their weake legges of knowledge and vnderstanding ouer that daunger, neyther stay their sliding, comfor them sorrowing, vpholde them salling, or raise them vp beeing flat on their backes, in worldly and humaine weakenes Thou shalt therefore finde in this succeeding Treatise, a continuall demonstration of this misery, and a faithfull and strong hand to help thee in all these aduersities, so that by good vse it may proue as good to thy soule, as the angell that brought Poter out of prison, loosing his bands and opening the yron gates, holding fast
the eyes of all the watchmen, till hee was perfectly deliuered and recouered from bodily thraldome: Onely I pray God that no infirmitie, shame disdaine, incredulitie, labour or temptation, whatsoeuer, hinder thy desired recouery, that readest and wisliest the day of thine owne and Churches safety, foretold by the Prophet Ioel, Ierusalem shalbe all holy and the strangers shall passe by her no more, and I wish that thou maist more deepely affect this Treatise, because the author doth professe himselfe to bee no scholler, nor writing from conference or counsell with any, but being recouered with variety of heauy f • elinges in his smarting indured changes, as that same calling (spoken of (by Christ Iesus before Magistrates. Math: 10. Did humbly beseech the Lord for help, Wherevpon the writ that which was in the very instant ministred vnto him, euen the secret hidden Wisedome, & inestimable worth of the mistery in afflictions which the Angels desire to behold. 1 Pet: 1. 12: So manifesting vnto the world, that the corrections of the meeke, induring by patience, and silence, are euer accompanied with that vpholding, illuminating, and instructing staffe and grace of God, euen to make them partakers of his very holines, by sence of a continuall discipation of hindrances, and streaming comfort ministred vnto them in due season, warranted by the last writing of the worde. Reuel: 22. 1. 2. 3. Behold there shalbe no more curse, But the throwne of God and the Lambe, shalbe in the viuer of pure Water, and his seruant stall serue him. Euen so Amen, Come Lord Iesus quickly
